ControlAdapterSettings.Name: ReCaptcha replaces DNNCaptcha
ControlAdapterSettings.Decription:
This is a dynamic adapter, which intercepts the native DNN captcha control, and replaces it with the harder to crack Recaptcha from Google (see https://www.google.com/recaptcha/intro/index.html for more details)
TODO:
* Register a key for your site (see https://www.google.com/recaptcha/admin#list)
* Enter your public key in the "DNNCaptcha Handler Render" corresponding parameter and your private key in the "DNNCaptcha Handler Validate" corresponding parameter.
* Enable the adapter, save, any form with the native DNN Captcha should now display a Recaptcha instead. Note that the adapter works by solving, hiding the original DNN captcha and invalidating it upon failed Recaptcha validation.

DynamicHandlerSettings.Name: DNNCaptcha Handler Render
DynamicHandlerSettings.Decription:
This dynamic handler extends the native DNNCaptcha Html rendering to:
* Hide the native DNN Captcha being replaced and fill the original Textbox with the correct value to have it solved by default.
* Insert the corresponding Recaptcha script, given the registered public key as configured in the handler parameters.

VariableInfo.Name: RecaptchaPublicKey
VariableInfo.Decription:
This is the public key provided to you upon registration of your website at https://www.google.com/recaptcha/admin#list.
Copy the key to the "Value" Textbox below.

ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Name: Add Recaptcha Html
ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Decription:
The Render method provides a "writer" parameter with type HtmlTextWriter to inject the corresponding Html into the page.
This is a simple Object action that calls the writer.Write(String s) method, passing the html content to be inserted as a string for Captcha replacement.

VariableInfo.Name: s
VariableInfo.Decription:
This is the html string being passed to the HtmlTextWriter.Write method in order to replace the original Captcha.
It is built from formatting a templated string with dynamic parameters for the Recaptcha public key and the original DNN Captcha solution.

VariableInfo.Name: RecaptchaCScriptStr
VariableInfo.Decription:
This is the templated script responsible for creating the Recaptcha html and hiding the original dnn captcha. Placeholders are included for dynamic insertion of recaptcha public key and dnn captcha solution value.
It contains:
* the Recaptcha Javascript block as detailed in the official documentation on the following page: https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/display.
* A jQuery command to solve and hide the original captcha being replaced.

VariableInfo.Name: DNNCaptchaResponse
VariableInfo.Decription:
This is a variable that collects the original DNN Captcha solution from the corresponding private member with a Flee expression.
In order to access the private member, it makes use of a dedicated Expression Owner set to the native Captcha control, with the appropriate member access.
See https://flee.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=ExpressionOwner&referringTitle=Examples for more information.

ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Name: Client Source Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Decription: Matches according to client identifying source parameters (Session, IP Address, country etc.)

ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Name: DotNetNuke Page Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Decription: Matches according to the target DNN Page as defined in the url

ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Name: Dynamic Expression Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Decription: Matches according to the evaluation of a dynamic code expression defined in the Flee language

ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Name: Membership Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Decription: Matches according to the user membership

ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Name: Portal Alias Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Decription: Matches according to the portal alias used in the url

ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Name: Static Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Decription: Simply matches according to the static value configured

ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Name: Sub Conditions Provider
ConditionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEve.Decription: Allows to build a condition tree with sub conditions

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Return Rest Operation Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Ends a rest web service dynamic method with a status and an optional result resource

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Define Variable
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to declare and instanciate a single variable, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Define Variables Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to declare and instanciate a set of variables, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Deserialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to deserialize a given string, result of dynamic expression, into a typed object

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Display Message Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Displays a DNN message with token replace on the current page. A target module can be optionnally chosen.

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Execute Sql Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Execute a call to a stored procedure, a Sql script or sql query and returns the result

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Expression Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider runs by evaluating a boolean expression and returning the result. The current PortalKeeperContext can be used as a dedicated variable

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: File Manager Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to browse or delete files and folders, given a parent path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: File Read Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to read a file to a given String variable, given its path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: File Write Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to write a content to a file, given its path and the content to write by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Object Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to do actions on object by setting properties, calling methods or hooking event handlers

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Log Event Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Inserts a new log in the DotNetNuke event log. Automatic email alert can be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Loop
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot over a custom collection. On each run, the current item of the collection is affected to a custom variable.

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Multiple Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Runs sub sequences of Actions

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Object Actions Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to call object methods or set object properties

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Load Profile Property
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to load an indentity or personnalization profile property for a given user.

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Save Profile Property
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to save an identity or personnalization profile property for a given user.

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Redirect Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Redirect the current client to a specified url

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Run Program Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Run an executable program given its path and parameters

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Send Email Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Sends an email to a list of destination addresses. Token replace is available for all text fields and target address list.

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Serialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to serialize a given entity, result of dynamic expression, into a string

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: String Filter Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to you to manipulate a string, by either running a series of transformations or performing xpath selects

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Sub Bot Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to run a sub-bot as a dedicated action. Because of the sequential nature of the engine, the subbot triggers each previous step up to the current step, the rules and action should be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: Web Action
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: Performs a web call to a web address

ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Name: While Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfSimpleEngineEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot while a boolean condition evaluates to true.

DynamicHandlerSettings.Name: DNNCaptcha Handler Validate
DynamicHandlerSettings.Decription:
This dynamic handler hooks to the native DNNCaptcha UserValidated event:
* Only if the native DNN Captcha is valid (to prevent infinite loop since the event is fired again upon unvalidation).
* Extracts the Recaptcha Challenge and Solution from the posted form.
* Calls Google web service with those values to validate Recaptcha.
* If Recaptcha fails to validate, invalidates the original DNN Captcha, which triggers DNN Localized validation error message.

VariableInfo.Name: RecaptchaPrivateKey
VariableInfo.Decription:
This is the private key provided to you upon registration of your website at https://www.google.com/recaptcha/admin#list.
Copy the key to the "Value" Textbox below.

ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Name: Check ReCaptcha if dnncaptcha is valid
ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Decription: The actions of that handler are grouped within a conditional Action, which checks for DNN Captcha validity. This is to prevent an infinite loop since in case of Recaptcha invalidation, the original event is fired again and should not trigger the action sequence again.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineE.Name: Get DNNCaptcha ValidState
ConditionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineE.Decription:
That condition checks the IsValid Property of the passed event args.
Note that DNN fails to properly use the System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs item. Usually, one would invalidate the event by setting that property to false, which is not accounted for by DNN. Instead, we have to call the Validate method with an arbitrary failing value.

ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Name: Get ReCaptchaChallenge from posted Data
ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Decription: This action defines the ReCaptchaChallenge variable, as submitted in the user form, to be passed to the call to Google Recaptcha web service.

Variable.Name: ReCaptchaChallenge
Variable.Decription: The variable is defined as a dynamic Flee expression over the default Expression Owner of type PortalKeeperContext , which exposes the DNNContext property, with subproperties to access the main Request components.

ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Name: Get ReCaptchaResponse from posted Data
ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Decription: This action defines the ReCaptchaResponse variable, as submitted in the user form, to be passed to the call to Google Recaptcha web service.

Variable.Name: ReCaptchaResponse
Variable.Decription: The variable is defined as a dynamic Flee expression over the default Expression Owner of type PortalKeeperContext , which exposes the DNNContext property, with subproperties to access the main Request components.

ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Name: Call Google service to Validate Recaptcha value
ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Decription: This is a web action that posts the Recaptcha Challenge and solution variables as previously retrieved from the posted user form, and sets the returned string to the ReCaptchaVerifResult variable.

VariableInfo.Name: privatekey
VariableInfo.Decription: This is the Recaptcha private key, as registered on Google's dedicated Recaptcha web site, and declared in the global Dynamic Handler parameters for easier configuration.

VariableInfo.Name: remoteip
VariableInfo.Decription:
As defined in Recaptcha API (see https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/verify), this is the IP address of the user who solved the Recaptcha.
It is computed from a dynamic Flee expression over the default Expression Owner of type PortalKeeperContext , which exposes the DNNContext property, with subproperties to access the main Request components.
The IPAddress property used here accounts for Http Headers to figure out the correct IP address when the client or server are behind proxies or firewalls.

VariableInfo.Name: challenge
VariableInfo.Decription:
According to the official documentation (see https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/verify), this is the value of the form field provided by Google together with the challenge image.
It is defined from the previously retrieved ReCaptchaChallenge Variable.

VariableInfo.Name: response
VariableInfo.Decription:
According to the official documentation (see https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/verify), this is the value of the form field filled by the user.
It is defined from the previously retrieved ReCaptchaResponse Variable.

ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Name: Unvalidate native DNNCaptcha if ReCaptcha is invalid
ActionProviderSettingsOfSimpleEngineEven.Decription:
In order to keep the original DNN API functional, we previously forced the native DNNCaptcha to automatically validate. Now, if the Recaptcha version is invalid, we force the native DNNCatpcha to invalidate.
This is done by checking the Http Response sent from Google service for validity, and passing an arbitrary wrong value to the DotNetNuke.UI.WebControls.CaptchaControl.Validate(String userData) method

VariableInfo.Name: userData
VariableInfo.Decription: The passed parameter is arbitrary and choosen to always invalidate the native DNN Captcha.

ControlAdapterSettings.Name: Log Viewer Personalization Example
ControlAdapterSettings.Decription: This is a simple example on how to hook a dynamic adapter to an existing user control. Those dynamic handler save user's customization into dedicated profile properties, and retrieves them on subsequent visits.
